intro: Leschenaultia acutiloba, commonly known as the narrow-leafed leschenaultia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. It features slender, upright stems with narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The flowers are small and yellow, arranged in dense clusters, making it a valuable plant for pollinators in its native habitat.
